page.title: 17Farming on the edge of Derby
page.content: Farming patterns in the area reflect the differing soils and the proximity to the urban area.Much of the city is built on alluvial gravels. On this level land the water table is always close to the surface resulting in wet soils suitable for grazing. Further south the undulating land is underlain by glacial till which is more suited to arable farming although there are large areas of grazing. On this grassland many farmers keep{Fresian} dairy cattle although cross bred beef breeds are not uncommon and sheep have also been observed. Most of the arable land is devoted to barley with some wheat but a relative newcomer is {oil-seed rape,}whose yellow flowers transform the fields in May.
